intro: Kyllinga kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamtschatka spikerush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along shores and tidal flats. Its slender, grass-like stems are often adorned with small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. Kyllinga kamtschatica plays a role in stabilizing coastal habitats and providing habitat for various small organisms.
